Warning:  In addition to the requested idea, there is years of frustration and cynicism sprinkled throughout the message.  Read at your own peril, but I refuse to "play nice" after years of contempt delivered directly from Rioters about my favorite champion.

> [{quoted}](name=Kindlejack,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=vQy5EUkW,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-02-25T22:29:31.512+0000)
>
> I clicked on this link hoping to see some suggestions to add to my mental pile. Hypothetically, if we made one Yaroick skin, after all these years, what would you want it to be?

Could you, at the very least, spell **"Yorick's"** name correctly?

Now, I'd love to see Riot make a Yorick skin that would be worth the 6+ year wait.  Definitely not something insulting, like a lazy Blood Moon Yorick re-color.  (I hate that skin line, since it seems to be your team's default for champs that need a new skin but that you can't come up with a truly awesome concept for.  Kennen, Zilean, Jhin and Talon are all examples of this conceptual laziness.)

For a real example, however:

Raid Boss Yorick
Ultimate Level skin with a 1350 RP price point (or cheaper).

Changing forms:  Goes from Arcade/Battle Boss to Project/Program to Battlecast/Pulsefire at will (with a 15 minute cooldown between forms), much like an MMO raid boss with multiple forms.  Maiden/Mist Walkers would also through similar transformations.  Sound effects, particles, voice manipulations to be changed as appropriately.

Spawning quote:  _"About damn time those bastards in Santa Monica / Los Angeles gave me some attention."_
Taunt:  _"Hey, I bet you want to try me out now!"_

And everything else that the _allegedly_ creative Personalization team would add to a champion skin of this nature.

This skin would also come with an apology from Riot for the long and inexcusable wait and a legally binding promise that the skins team will work super hard to help Yorick catch up to champs of similar age that have more skins.

Riot isn't obligated to give us skins.  Yorick has quite a low play rate so ofc he isn't going to get many skins. They aren't going to waste their time to make a skin that only a handful of people will use.

> [{quoted}](name=DJMason88,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=vQy5EUkW,comment-id=000200030000,timestamp=2017-02-26T22:15:27.876+0000)
>
> Riot isn't obligated to give us skins.  Yorick has quite a low play rate so ofc he isn't going to get many skins. They aren't going to waste their time to make a skin that only a handful of people will use.

That is the **stupidest** thing I've read on these boards in a long time, even compared to my salty post.  Congratulations, sir.

1) For your information, Riot Games is a company that claims to be about _all their players_.  All of them, even the ones who like and enjoy the "less popular champs."  If they ever claimed otherwise, we wouldn't be having this conversation.

2) You seem to believe that Riot exists in some sort of bubble or ivory tower, handing out little trinkets to the masses at their whim and leaving the rest to suffer.  Supposedly, Riot's philosophy is the exact opposite of that line of thinking, and that they would happily "waste their time" on something like that as opposed to, I dunno, giving Blitzcrank a visual upgrade because a "handful of people" hate his design.

3) Your "handful of people" still equates to _millions of players and hundreds of thousands of potential sales_ now and in the future. (if Riot's telling the truth about how many people play the game worldwide).  If the product is cool/awesome enough or hyped like Riot's other skins, a new Yorick skin will also inspire millions of other players to pick up the champ and possibly buy the skin.

So, yeah, your comment was pretty stupid.  Cheers!

I am on the team and I get salty! It's even harder being involved and understanding the decision process and all the factors involved, knowing the reasons (not always agreeing with them) and trusting in the Product Owners. My favourite champions in the game are Rumble, Fiddlesticks, Nocturne and Swain, but I get to see the bigger picture and understand that every champion is someone's favourite. Then I am trusted by my fellow Rioters to act in the best interest of our players, not just on a per-skin basis but also at a bigger picture level which involves content plans over years as well as the ongoing development and support of the game and the community.

The most difficult problem I have in interacting with the community is that I'm not allowed to talk about everything we are planning to do. For years we knew about Universe and all the awesome new lore stuff the Foundations team had been hard at work on, but we had to keep our lips tight while empathising with the frustration of lore fans. In the same way this new Zyra skin took a huge amount of work and was in the pipeline for a long time and I really wanted to be able to say 'We are working on something awesome hold on just a little longer!', but I also understand why we can't. Mentioning Dragon Master Swain, cancelling it, trying to make it again and having to cancel it a second time is the perfect example of why it is much worse to announce work in progress when we can't guarantee it will actually work out and ship. I hesitate to even type the words **Magma Chamber**...

The thing I'd really like to be able to share with players though is what it's like to be on a team at Riot. We play LoL, we take it seriously, we compare ELO, we watch the LCS, we lurk Reddit (and Inven etc) and we argue a LOT. All of us are driven to create the best experiences for players and we agonise over every decision. Every day I'm surprised by how carefully everything is planned and how thoughtful Rioters are. Rioters care so much about players that if we agree something is the right thing to do for players there's really no excuse that can stop that momentum. After the [Cosplay Creator Lab](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/community/community-spotlight/cosplay-challenge-conquered) I'm even thinking about how my designs might be cosplayed and how much misery my decisions could be causing in terms of complexity! I think comments that make fun of Riot are great because they keep us honest; I always get a chuckle out of 'More Teemo Skins', although the reality is there was a lot of serious talk about if we should do Devil Teemo because of how the meme has affected Rioters impression of community reception. Btw players LOVED it and we were so relieved!

We've been pouring over the feedback and reaction to Zyra, the whole team are behind this one. Right now I think as a team we are focused on making sure that when those skins do happen, they are worth the wait.

Hey Kindlejack! Sorry for necroing your post, but I had a really awesome idea for a Yorick skin and would like to share it with you if you're still looking for concepts ^-^. 

Well, I think the Hextech thematic would be an awesome fit for Yorick. All his pets and minions could be super high-tech creations of his own making, while Yorick himself could be decked out in steampunk clothing, wielding a shovel-like gadget imbued with a hextech crystal (this crystal could light up upon activation of his Q, kind of like Camille's Q activates the one on her chestpiece). 

Yorick's Maiden (R) would be the most challenging part of this skin I feel, in terms of modeling it's not super clear what could be done with her, but honestly any kind of high-tech metal robot would do, in the vein of Hextech Annie's Tibbers or new Hextech Galio -- it could even be a creepy robot meant to detect ghosts, or perhaps siphon/collect them (ghost in the shell? ;)

Anyway, I think the new visual style of the Hextech line is really cool and high quality, and I'm sure Yorick players both new and old would appreciate a skin of that caliber. "Steampunk tinkerer who creates high-tech robots to fight with" would be a super cool fantasy/direction for him, IMO.
Thanks for the reply! I agree that sounds pretty cool, anything that plays well with his minions seems like it'd go over well :)

was wondering about maiden, is there a rule about her shape?

The new kog'maw kinda break the must look like the original model, so can we imagine a big jellyfish for the maiden?

I dunno most Blitzcrank skins change his silhouette radically. There aren't hard and fast rules for skins we just have designers keeping a close eye on development and try our best to understand gameplay limitations and mitigate risk while also trying to push the boundaries of how impactful a skin can be.

Sometimes something can be really different; Fizz's fish can be a screaming carrot because the movement and size are similar. Sometimes things need to be virtually unchanged; Ahri's orb has strong gameplay reads that mean it can't be a screaming carrot :P

Can it be a screaming carrot only when it's thrown or is it tied to the effect that's constantly in her hand? (I mean, I'm not advocating for Cottontail Ahri, but now I _do_ want her throwing screaming carrots... Screaming carrot Fox Fire? Mad Chef Ahri?)

I think Yorick could make an amazing void-based skin if taken in a slightly different direction than the usual Voidborn ones. One of the main thematic draws of new Yorick to me is the feeling of barely being in control of this immensely powerful force, and the Void is easily the next strongest contender to come to mind. 

Instead of the massive stone on his back in his current skins, he could have some sort of large void creature adhered there, parasitizing him in a way that's half Zerg and half Ratatouille. With little void critters as his walkers, a much bigger one as the Maiden, I think it would look super great. I love the way more recent void monsters (Rek'Sai, Rift Herald, etc) have really captured that "alien" nature and I think it would work super well with Yorick. 

With how many examples of Void-y particle effects there are, I don't think making his E or Q effects match would be too challenging, and there's tons of space for ideation with the W as well! (Wall of void-y flesh? Tentacles pop up from the ground? Even more massive void monster pops out of the ground, the walls being formed on its back?, etc)

You talked about champion choices and your favorite champions, So who gets last say in what skin comes out? I am a fan of Yasuo, Malzahar, Vlad, and a few others. Yes, I am a big old tumor. But many of these champion don't have many skins or haven't received one for years. What are your(personal) thoughts on getting a VU for Malzahar and getting him a new skin? Or getting Yasuo the evil overload skin, since like Teemo, people see him as pure evil.

Skins has a primary Product Owner, [Supercakes] and several squad level POs that plan out skins for the year. Often they provide us with a set of champions to develop a theme for, or a theme with the champions chosen more open to discussion, occasionally it's just a slot for a one off that could be anything with the only condition being we choose a highly played champion.

Malzahar had an update in the mage update, so I don't think he'll be in line for a VGU in the next few years. But he's one of the few champs that are on the short list that haven't gotten a skin since I started at Riot in 2015 so I'm fighting for him. Yasuo is actually the most popular champion in LoL, by a wide margin, so it's safe to say he'll be getting skins until he reaches teemo-meme status. Although given that he's only had two skins since launch he is also a good indicator that we aren't just following the popularity, and that sometimes things don't go as planned, or he'd surely have like 10.
